de.rincewind.api.gui.windows

Interface WindowEnchanter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EventBased, Modifyable, Window, WindowContainer, WindowEditor, WindowNameable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CraftWindowEnchanter, Windows.WindowEnchanterExtendable

    public interface WindowEnchanter
extends WindowEditor
    This window is a BrewingInventory. To set elements in this window, you can use four slots:
    • Slot 0: new Point(0, 1) (left potion-slot)
    • Slot 1: new Point(1, 1) (middle potion-slot)
    • Slot 2: new Point(2, 1) (right potion-slot)
    • Slot 3: new Point(1, 0) (catalyst)
    Specially in this window you can set the enchantment-offers. The slot at the top has the ID 0. That one in the middle 1, and ID 2 on the bottom.
    Since:
    2.3.3
    Author:
    Rincewind34
    See Also:
    Windows.WindowEnchanterExtendable

    • Method Detail

      • setOffer

        void setOffer(int slot,
              int lvl)
        Sets the enchantment-offer in a specified slot. To update the slots invoke update().
        Parameters:
        slot - to change
        lvl - to set
        Throws:
        InvalidSlotException - if the slot is smaller than 0 or greater than 2

      • update

        void update()
        Updates the offers to the user. If the window does not have an user, this method will do nothing.

      • getOffer

        int getOffer(int slot)
        Returns the currently set offer. The default-offer for all slots is 0.
        Parameters:
        slot - to get
        Returns:
        the currently set offer
